quizzes.title: History Quiz: Perfumes and Preparation
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, dessert, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of fragrance by standard consists of 10-20% aromatic compounds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eau de Parfum

questions.question: This fruit does not yield the expected scent when extracted and achieving its aroma requires the use of synthetic substitutes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In what European country did the first modern perfume originate in 1370?
To what perfume category do vanilla fragrances belong according to the modern classification of scents?
What animal is used for the preparation of the French delicacy Escargot?
What shouldnt perfumes and fragrances be exposed to in order to preserve their properties longer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What important nutrient is the pineapple fruit rich in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What part of a duck or goose is used for the preparation of the French meal Foie gras?
What is the common name used to refer to synthetic musk used as an ingredient in perfumes and other fragrances?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White musk

questions.question: What is the literal meaning of the Latin phrase per fumum from which the modern word perfume originated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Through smoke

questions.question: The combination of which perfume notes comprises the so-called main theme of a perfume?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Middle and base notes

questions.question: What animal produces the aromatic ambergris that is used for the preparation of flavors and perfumes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sperm whale

questions.question: What name is sometimes used to refer to perfumers, the experts who compose perfumes?
What type of food is Pate de coing, which is traditionally served at Christmas in the French region of Provence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quince jelly

questions.question: What is the main ingredient of the popular French dessert Teurgoule?

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Bridge and Type
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, making, chicken. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of meat is used for the preparation of the French dish called Pot-au-feu?
Which of the following is an example of the so-called relay bid in the contract bridge bidding system?

options.text: A 3 clubs opening with a 7-card clubs
A 2 diamonds answer after a 2 clubs opening from partner
A 3 clubs after a 2 No Trump opening from partner
A 2 No Trump answer after a 2 clubs opening from partner

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A 2 diamonds answer after a 2 clubs opening from partner

questions.question: Which top bridge player from India stimulated the development of bridge during the 60s and 70s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zia Maywood

questions.question: What type of chicken is used for the preparation of the traditional French meal Coq au vin?

options.text: Hen which has just begun to lay eggs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Older rooster

questions.question: In contract bridge, Jacoby transfers are a convention used by a responder following what kind of opening bid?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trump opening bid

questions.question: Which bridge terms refer to two weak openings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Multi and Muiderberg

questions.question: What type of food is the French delicacy called Andouillette?
Who invented the Stayman convention in contract bridge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Rapee

questions.question: What is the strongest opening bid in contract bridge according to Acol standards?
How many points are required to open with 1 No Trump opening bid according to the standards of the bridge bidding system Acol?
Crepe is the name of a thin French pancake. What is the meaning of the Latin word crispa from which the name of the dish originated?
This vegetable is the main ingredient of the traditional French dish Cassoulet.
In contract bridge, yarborough is a term referring to what type of hand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Containing no points at all

questions.question: How many players typically play a hand of classic Mahjong?
Which of these is not among the traditional ingredients used for the making of the popular French dish Tartiflette?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Mahjong and Milk
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, creatures, players. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In Mahjong, a pong is a set of how many identical tiles?
Which of these creatures continues to consume milk as an adult in the wild?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Which of these countries is the largest producer and consumer of cows milk in the world?
In Mahjong, a kong is a set of how many identical tiles?
In the game of Mahjong, these red, white and green tiles are considered honor tiles, and are worth more as pongs and kongs than suit tile pongs and kongs.
Which of these vitamins is fat-soluble and is found in the milk fat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin K

questions.question: What does the term crop milk refer to?

options.text: The secretion of white liquid by some plants such as fig trees.
The secretion that some birds use to feed their young.
The first milk that the mammary glands produce after labor.
Milk produced from seeds and nuts such as almond, soy, rice, etc.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The secretion that some birds use to feed their young.

questions.question: Flower tiles are not necessary to win a hand in a classic Mahjong game.
In the 13-tile variation of Mahjong, which of the following is a possible winning hand?

options.text: 4 pongs and a pair of identical tiles
2 kongs and a pair of identical tiles

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 pongs and a pair of identical tiles

questions.question: The milk of which of these mammals is used for consumption by humans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is a chow in the game of Mahjong?

options.text: a meld of four suited tiles in sequence
a meld of three suited tiles in sequence
a meld of two suited tiles in sequence
a meld of six suited tiles in sequence

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a meld of three suited tiles in sequence

questions.question: Which of these cities is known as the Milk Capital of the World?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvard, Illinois

questions.question: In Mahjong, the dealer is East, with the other players assuming the corresponding direction. If the dealer wins the round, the dealer remains East.
Which of these Western games is most similar to Mahjong?
What are the three suits of Mahjong?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: stones, bamboos, characters

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What alcoholic beverage is produced from herbs including the bitter herb commonly known as wormwood?
What chemical present in the grapefruit gives it its unique taste and flavor?
What is the meaning of the Arabic phrase qahwat al-bunn, from which the English word coffee was derived through Turkish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wine of the bean

questions.question: What  vitamin is found in high amounts in the bitter root of the turnip plant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin C

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the pasteurization of milk?

options.text: It extends the shelf life of milk.
The pasteurized milk still needs to be refrigerated.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Bitter melon, or bitter gourd, has been traditionally used by Asians, Panamanians and Colombians in the prevention and treatment of this disease.
Conjugated linoleic acid, present in milk, is proven to cure in vitro what disease?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The fruit of most olive species contain phenolic compounds and oleuropein which make the fruit too bitter. However, the fruit of this olive cultivar can be eaten fresh.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thassos Olive

questions.question: Which of these fictional characters is known for wearing a top hat all the time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: A study on 2,018 women showed that the consumption of green tea and mushrooms decreases the risk of developing this disease by 90%.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breast cancer

questions.question: What common expression is used to refer to beer to point out its excellent nutritional properties?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liquid bread

questions.question: Which of these essential nutrients is present naturally in milk?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Who is credited with the invention of the potato chip on August 24, 1853?

options.text: Because one of the ingredients is birds nest
Because it is made with a large amount of thin noodles that look like a birds nest when served
Because is is made from baby swallows
Because it is served in a bowl arranged in a way to resemble a birds nest
